content.data: Add Shelf Pins to My Job
I want to add shelf pins to all of my adjustable shelves and have them show up on my Assembly Sheets and Material Summaries. How do I do this?

From the CABINET VISION System Level go to the  Part Manager . 
 
 
 Click on the Pulls group in the sidebar. 
 
 
 Click on the New option in the ribbonand Name it SHFPN. 
 
 
 For Description type in Shelf Pin. 
 
 
 Click Close to leave the Parts Manager. 
 
 
 Go to the  Material Manager . 
 
 
 Go to the Pull Category or whatever Category you want to use to store the Shelf Pin. 
 
 
 Create a new Miscellaneous Material and name it Shelf Pin (Or whatever name/part number you use). 
 
 
 Return to the opening screenand go to  Material Schedules | Pulls . 
 
 
 Attach the Shelf Pin Material to the Shelf Pin item in the Pulls Schedules you use. 
 
 
 Close back out to the opening screen.
From the CABINET VISION System Level go to the  Part Manager .
From the CABINET VISION System Level go to the  Part Manager .
Click on the Pulls group in the sidebar.
Click on the Pulls group in the sidebar.
Click on the New option in the ribbonand Name it SHFPN.
Click on the New option in the ribbonand Name it SHFPN.
For Description type in Shelf Pin.
For Description type in Shelf Pin.
Click Close to leave the Parts Manager.
Click Close to leave the Parts Manager.
Go to the  Material Manager .
Go to the  Material Manager .
Go to the Pull Category or whatever Category you want to use to store the Shelf Pin.
Go to the Pull Category or whatever Category you want to use to store the Shelf Pin.
Create a new Miscellaneous Material and name it Shelf Pin (Or whatever name/part number you use).
Create a new Miscellaneous Material and name it Shelf Pin (Or whatever name/part number you use).
Return to the opening screenand go to  Material Schedules | Pulls .
Return to the opening screenand go to  Material Schedules | Pulls .
Attach the Shelf Pin Material to the Shelf Pin item in the Pulls Schedules you use.
Attach the Shelf Pin Material to the Shelf Pin item in the Pulls Schedules you use.
Close back out to the opening screen.
Close back out to the opening screen.
Now you can write a  User Created Standard  to add the Shelf Pin to all of your Adjustable Shelves. Below is the text to utilize in your UCS:
;Links 4 Shelf Pins to Each Adjustable Shelf
For Each  AS Part
Dim  SHFPN as New Pull
SHFPN.Visible  =  False
SHFPN.DX  = . 125
SHFPN.DY  = . 125
SHFPN.X  =  0
SHFPN.Y  =  0
SHFPN.Z  =  0
SHFPN.AX  =  0
SHFPN.AY  =  0
SHFPN.AZ  =  0
SHFPN.QTY  =  4
Now go to a  new  Job and Place a Cabinet on a Wall.
Now go to a  new  Job and Place a Cabinet on a Wall.
Now go to a  new  Job and Place a Cabinet on a Wall.
When you print your  Assembly Sheet  for that Cabinet, look in the Hardware Section and you will see your Shelf Pin hardware listed.
